title: Charlson Comorbidity Index (CCI)
description: Predicts 10-year survival in patients with multiple comorbidities. Uses 19 weighted comorbidity categories plus age adjustment to estimate mortality risk and guide clinical decision-making.

parameters.name: age
parameters.description: Patient age in years. Age adjustment: 0 points (<50), 1 point (50-59), 2 points (60-69), 3 points (70-79), 4 points (≥80)

parameters.name: myocardial_infarction
parameters.description: History of myocardial infarction (1 point if present)

parameters.name: congestive_heart_failure
parameters.description: Congestive heart failure (1 point if present)

parameters.name: peripheral_vascular_disease
parameters.description: Peripheral vascular disease (1 point if present)

parameters.name: cerebrovascular_disease
parameters.description: Cerebrovascular accident or TIA (1 point if present)

parameters.name: chronic_pulmonary_disease
parameters.description: Chronic pulmonary disease (1 point if present)

parameters.name: connective_tissue_disease
parameters.description: Connective tissue disease (1 point if present)

parameters.name: peptic_ulcer_disease
parameters.description: Peptic ulcer disease (1 point if present)

parameters.name: liver_disease
parameters.description: Liver disease severity. Mild (1 point), Moderate-Severe (3 points), None (0 points). Mutually exclusive with diabetes categories.

parameters.name: diabetes
parameters.description: Diabetes severity. Uncomplicated (1 point), With end-organ damage (2 points), None (0 points). Mutually exclusive with liver disease categories.

parameters.name: moderate_severe_ckd
parameters.description: Moderate to severe chronic kidney disease (2 points if present)

parameters.name: localized_solid_tumor
parameters.description: Localized solid tumor (2 points if present)

parameters.name: metastatic_solid_tumor
parameters.description: Metastatic solid tumor (6 points if present)

result.name: charlson_assessment
result.description: Charlson Comorbidity Index score with 10-year survival probability

ranges.interpretation: Score 0-1: Excellent 10-year survival (>90%). Minimal impact from comorbidities on life expectancy.
Score 2-3: Good 10-year survival (70-90%). Moderate impact from comorbidities on life expectancy.
Score 4-5: Reduced 10-year survival (30-70%). Significant impact from comorbidities on life expectancy.
Score ≥6: Poor 10-year survival (<30%). Severe impact from comorbidities on life expectancy.

references: Charlson ME, Pompei P, Ales KL, MacKenzie CR. A new method of classifying prognostic comorbidity in longitudinal studies: development and validation. J Chronic Dis. 1987;40(5):373-83.
Charlson M, Szatrowski TP, Peterson J, Gold J. Validation of a combined comorbidity index. J Clin Epidemiol. 1994;47(11):1245-51.
Deyo RA, Cherkin DC, Ciol MA. Adapting a clinical comorbidity index for use with ICD-9-CM administrative databases. J Clin Epidemiol. 1992;45(6):613-9.
formula: CCI Score = Sum of comorbidity points + Age adjustment points. 10-year survival = 0.983^(CCI × 0.9)
notes: Developed in 1987 by Charlson et al. for predicting 10-year mortality
Age adjustment: <50y (0 pts), 50-59y (1 pt), 60-69y (2 pts), 70-79y (3 pts), ≥80y (4 pts)
Higher scores indicate higher predicted mortality and lower 10-year survival
Liver disease categories are mutually exclusive (mild vs moderate-severe)
Diabetes categories are mutually exclusive (uncomplicated vs with end-organ damage)
Widely used in clinical research and practice for risk stratification
Helps guide treatment intensity and screening decisions based on life expectancy
Originally validated in hospitalized medical patients
Formula assumes theoretical low-risk population with 98.3% 10-year survival
